catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 474
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: standing male figure with stringy moustache, and long flowing black hair; lotus blossoms and flames around halo; draping colorful skirts; bare chested with draping sashes
text: Temple records date the printing of this work—part of a set of Juniten (Twelve Heavenly Guardians)—to the year Ōei 14 (1407), making it the earliest major documented work of artistic printing known in Japan.
title: Nitten 日天 (The Sun God)
